alert.note: Alert for Eastern Montgomery; Western Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Montgomery County through 730 PM EDT... At 659 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Collegeville, or 20 miles northeast of West Chester, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Norristown, Lansdale, West Norriton, East Norriton, Hatboro, Souderton, Ambler, Collegeville, Trappe, Hatfield, Schwenksville, Spring Mount, Willow Grove, King Of Prussia, Horsham, Skippack, Telford, North Wales, Harleysville and Evansburg. This includes Northeast Extension between mile markers 22 and 38. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southeastern Pennsylvania.
